title: Income Tax Returns
question_text:
Assume that $37\%$ of all Americans are late filing their income tax returns.
You ask $100$ randomly selected Americans if they were late filing their tax returns, and $45$ of them say they were late.
How unusual is your result, or rather, what is the probability that you would get a result that high, or higher, from a sample of $100$, rounded to the nearest hundredth?
